intro: Moraea fugacissima, commonly known as the fleeting moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a short-lived perennial, often blooming only once before it dies, which contributes to its common name. Its unique floral structure and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in its native habitat.
